intro: Pentadenia lutea, commonly known as the yellow panic grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its erect, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Pentadenia lutea is well adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant.
